string.text: A standard round for the Colt 1911 and Sig 220 pistols. It has a standard core and a full-jacketed bullet.
A so called Hydro-Shock round with improved characteristics for the Colt 1911 and Sig 220 pistols. It has a hollow-point bullet with a good stopping effect.

A standard 12 calibre round filled with 6 mm shot. It has an enormous killing power at a close range. It’s designed for the TOZ-34, BM-12, Winchester 1300, and SPAS 12 shotguns. It’s most effective at a range less then 30 metres.

A finned bullet. It can stabilize in flight, therefore it has increased accuracy. It’s designed for the TOZ-34, BM-12, Winchester 1300, and SPAS 12 shotguns. It has an armour-piercing effect and an increased range – it is effective at a range up to 150 metres.

A round with a heavy naked bullet. It’s usually used for large animal hunting, but can also be used for other purposes. Its heavy bullet does not pierce but actually forces through the armour vests. It’s designed for the TOZ-34, BM-12, Winchester 1300, and SPAS 12 shotguns. It’s effective at a range up to 100 metres.
An armour-piercing round for the AKS-74, AKS-74U, AN-94 assault rifles. It has an improved armour-piercing effect but a decreased stopping effect.
A standard round for the AKS-74, AKS-74U, AN-94 assault rifles. It has a standard core and a full-jacketed bullet.
A round with an armour-piercing bullet for the L85, LR300, Sig550, G36, FN2000 assault rifles.
A standard NATO round widely-known under its Belgian SS109 index. It’s used with the L85, LR300, Sig550, G36, FN2000 assault rifles.
A cheap modification of the sniper round for the SVD, SVU-AS sniper rifles and the PKM machine gun.
A sniper round for the SVD, SVU-AS sniper rifles and the PKM machine gun. It has an improved accuracy and range.
A round with an armour-piercing bullet for the SVD, SVU-AS sniper rifles and the PKM machine gun.
A standard round for the PM, PB, Fort-12 pistols. It has a standard core and a full-jacketed bullet. It has a weak armour-piercing effect.

A round with improved ballistic characteristics for the PM, PB, Fort-12 pistols. Due to the high initial velocity of its bullet it’s much more effective then a standard round. It has a better armour-piercing effect.
A standard round for the Walther P99, Beretta 92FS pistols and the H&K MP5 submachine gun. It has a full-jacketed bullet with a weak armour-piercing effect.
An improved round for the Walther P99, Beretta 92FS pistols and the H&K MP5 submachine gun. A high-power round with a hollow-point bullet and an armour-piercing core.

An armour-piercing round for the Groza, Val assault rifles and the Vintorez special sniper rifle. It has a subsonic bullet which due to its special design can penetrate most armour vests at a range up to 300 metres.

A round for the Groza, Val assault rifles and the Vintorez special sniper rifle. The later and cheaper modification of the armour-piercing round. It has a subsonic bullet which due to its special design can penetrate most armour vests at a range up to 300 metres.

A sniper round for the Groza, Val assault rifles and the Vintorez special sniper rifle. It has a subsonic bullet which due to its heavy weight and special design can penetrate most armour vests at a range up to 400 metres.
Energy cells with prepared killing elements in a gauss rifle magazine. The energy source is an encapsulated piece of a Flash artefact.
A grenade for the Ì203 grenade launcher (for the LR-300, G36, Sig550, L85 rifles) and the integrated grenade launcher in FN2000.
A high-explosive grenade for the RPG-7V. It’s equally effective against both manpower and light armoured vehicles.
A grenade for the GP-25 Kostyer grenade launcher, the integrated grenade launcher of Groza, and the RG-6 revolver grenade launcher.

A grenade for the GP-25 Kostyer grenade launcher, the integrated grenade launcher of Groza, and the RG-6 revolver grenade launcher. Prior explosion the grenade leaps up about one metre increasing its killing effect.
A defensive hand grenade with a large radius of splinter damage. It’s recommended to through it only from behind a cover.
An offensive hand grenade with a small radius of splinter damage.

The weapon of the elite troops of the Russian army. It was designed as a replacement for the outdated AK-74. Not only the Abakan’s internal mechanisms but also its receiver and its barrel are movable, that allows to decrease the recoil and thus to increase the accuracy.
 Ammunition:
 standard 5.45x39 mm,
 armour-piercing 5.45x39 mm BP.

UNIQUE WEAPON. A new version of the AN-94 assault rifle equipped with an even more perfect system of recoil damping. It is more accurate even when firing bursts.
 Ammunition:
 standard 5.45x39 mm,
 armour-piercing 5.45x39 mm BP.
A grenade launcher for the AK-74 and AKS-74.\n Ammunition: VOG-25 grenade,\n and VOG-25R grenade.
A grenade launcher for the Sig 550, LR300, G36, L85A2.\n Ammunition: M209 grenades.
A widely used Soviet scope. The scope can be mounted on a weapon using a dovetail mount standard for the Warsaw Pact countries.
A 4-x scope produced in the NATO countries. It can be attached to a standard NATO mount, so called the Picatinni rail.
An effective silencer made by some craftsmen in the Zone. The kit includes a set of adapters for any weapon of any calibre.

A Kalashnikov assault rifle with a folding butt, model of 1974, uses 5.45x39 mm ammunition. It’s a simple and reliable weapon, but the cheapness of its production slightly influenced its convenience and accuracy. In the Zone it’s the main weapon of the army stalkers and of many lone fighters.
 Ammunition:
 standard 5.45x39 mm,
 armour-piercing 5.45x39 mm BP.

UNIQUE WEAPON. The gas cylinder and the spring of the lock frame of this assault rifle are replaced with the ones modified by some craftsman, as a result the rate of fire is increased from 600 to 850 rounds per minute.
 Ammunition:
 standard 5.54x39 mm,
 armour-piercing 5.45x39 mm BP.

The weight and size of the AKS-74U are similar to the ones of the submachine guns, but the principle of its mechanism operation and the ammunition used place it into the class of the assault rifles. Its advantages are its small dimensions very useful when fighting inside a building or in a thick forest and a relatively high piercing capability of its ammo. Its main disadvantages are a short accuracy range and quick overheating when firing bursts.
 Ammunition:
 standard 5.45x39 mm,
 armour-piercing 5.45x39 mm BP.

UNIQUE WEAPON. It’s rumoured that this assault rifle was found in a pile of metal waste in the Dump, at the very place where a gravitation anomaly “lived” for three months. Strangely enough, the AKS appeared to be in a good condition, and its being in the anomaly influenced it extraordinarily: the bullets shot from this weapon have much more energy.\n

It is adopted by the armed forces and the police of the USA and by many military and police units all over the world. It is also very popular among the criminals for its high-power round and its large-size magazine.
 Ammunition:
 standard 9x19 mm Parabellum,
 improved 9x19 mm PBP.

UNIQUE WEAPON. The newest modification of the M9, which is an American version of this weapon. It has a special barrel produced using the state-of-the-art technologies, therefore its accuracy and its killing effect are improved greatly.

A sawn-off BM-16 rifle. It’s lighter and more compact then the original two-barrel rifle, but it’s effective only at a close range. One of the weapons most commonly used by the beginners.
 Ammunition:
 12x70 shot,
 12x76 slug,
 12x76 dart.

A classical automatic Colt which participated in all the conflicts of the 20th century with honour and entered the new century with confidence. Its small-size magazine is partially compensated by the use of a high-power round.
 Ammunition:
 standard .45 ACP,
 improved .45 ACP Hydro-Shock.

A real gun for real heroes. It’s big, heavy, and very destructive. It’s not very popular in the Zone due to its price and size. After all, it’s not every day that you have to hunt an elephant!
 Ammunition:
 standard .45 ACP,
 improved .45 ACP Hydro-Shock.

An assault rifle combined with a grenade launcher. It’s equipped with a computer fire control module and a 40-mm grenade launcher.
 Ammunition:
 standard 5.56x45 mm SS109,
 armour-piercing 5.56x45 mm ÀÐ.

A police pistol of Ukrainian production, replaced the PM. In comparison with the Makarov pistol it has an improved accuracy, ergonomics, and a bigger magazine, but it’s less reliable.
 Ammunition:
 standard 9x18 mm,
 improved 9x18 mm +P+.

UNIQUE WEAPON. This model seems to be a prototype – no one knows how it got to the Zone. It has a new magazine fixation system which allows to use magazines with a larger capacity as compared to the standard models.
 Ammunition:
 standard 9x18 mm, 
 improved 9x18 mm +P+.

A German assault rifle. It’s a first-grade specimen of the modern weaponry: it’s light, reliable, and ergonomic.
 Ammunition:
 standard 5.56x45 mm SS109,
 armour-piercing 5.56x45 mm ÀÐ.

UNIQUE WEAPON. Even a serial G36 is one of the best assault rifles in the Zone. But even such high combat characteristics can be greatly improved. Someone of the Monolith group got an idea to grind a Gravy artefact and to rub the powder into the barrel outside and inside. As a result, the killing power and the accuracy of the rifle are greatly increased.
 Ammunition:
 standard 5.56x45 mm SS109,
 armour-piercing 5.56x45 mm ÀÐ

A super-accurate weapon made by the scientists in the Zone. It’s almost noiseless because it uses not the gunpowder gas energy but the artefact energy for firing. In spite of the gauss gun’s huge firepower its recoil is insignificant. The accuracy and the killing power of this gun exceed those of all the other small arms.\n Ammunition – 2-mm gauss rounds.
UNIQUE WEAPON. This gun’s accumulator is made on the basis of a rear Battery artefact, therefore it has enough energy for more shots.\n Ammunition – 2-mm gauss rounds.

An assault rifle combined with a grenade launcher. It’s a very good type of assault rifle for the Zone conditions: it’s compact, reliable, but universal and powerful. The Groza is one of the favourite rifles of the army stalkers.\ Ammunition:
 standard 9x39 mm PAB-9,
 armour-piercing 9x39 mm SP-6,
 sniper 9x39 mm SP-5,
 VOG-25 and VOG-25R grenades for the grenade launcher.

UNIQUE WEAPON. This weapon was presented to general Voronin by a gunsmith as a gratitude for saving his life. This Groza was skilfully and thoroughly updated, many parts were replaced completely. Due to the improvement, its combat characteristics are much better then those of the standard model.\ Ammunition:
 standard 9x39 mm PAB-9,
 armour-piercing 9x39 mm SP-6,
 sniper 9x39 mm SP-5,
 VOG-25 and VOG-25R grenades for the grenade launcher.

The Browning deserves to be considered one of the best pistols of the 20th century. It’s reliable, powerful, and has a good grouping of shots. The magazine can hold 13 rounds.\n Ammunition:\n standard 9x19 mm Parabellum,n\ improved 9õ19 mm PBP.

After the army of Great Britain replaced this rifle with The German G36, it appeared in large quantities first in the black market and then in the Zone. The L85A2’s main advantages are a standard 4-x scope and a high accuracy of the first shot. When shooting bursts its accuracy decreases greatly, and the main mechanisms of the rifle are not reliable enough.
 Ammunition:
 standard 5.56x45 mm SS109,
 armour-piercing 5.56x45 mm ÀÐ.

UNIQUE WEAPON. It seems that this rifle was modified by a talented gunsmith some time ago. He had to spend some time on it but as a result this rifle became more reliable and much more stable when shooting.
 Ammunition:
 standard 5.56x45 mm SS109,
 armour-piercing 5.56x45 mm ÀÐ.

A new stage of development of the famous M-16. The rifle’s name literally means “light rifle with effective fire range up to 300 metres”. Due its to exceptionally easy triggering, high ergonomics, and little weight, the weapon is highly accurate, though it is too sensitive to dirt and so is not always suitable for use under difficult field conditions.
 Ammunition:
 standard 5.56x45 mm SS109,
 armour-piercing 5.56x45 mm ÀÐ.

UNIQUE WEAPON. This model of the LR300 rifle was originally designed for a sniper. The work of the mechanisms has almost no influence on this rifle’s stability during the shot, therefore a more accurate fire is achieved. However, it has a significantly reduced rate of burst fire.
 Ammunition:
 standard 5.56x45 mm SS109,
 armour-piercing 5.56x45 mm ÀÐ

One of the best weapons in the submachine gun class. During the last decades of the 20th century it was adopted by the army and police special force units of many countries. When it was gradually replaced with more up-to-date models, it appeared in the black market, and then in the Zone.n\ Ammunition:\n standard 9x19 mm Parabellum,\n improved 9x19 mm PBP.

A pistol with an integrated silencer, it used to be adopted by Soviet special forces. It is outdated, but in skilful hands it is still very effective.
 Ammunition:
 standard 9x18 mm,
 improved 9x18 mm +P+.

The most widely spread pistol in the Zone. It’s a legacy of the Soviet epoch. It’s relatively reliable and cheap, has small magazine capacity, low power, and unsatisfactory grouping of shots. It’s a main weapon of a beginning stalker.
 Ammunition:
 standard 9x18 mm,
 improved 9x18 mm +P+.

A revolver type grenade launcher. Sometimes it’s just indispensable, particularly when moping-up wide areas of mutants, attacking well-guarded stationary objects or fighting especially tough creatures.\n Ammunition – VOG-25 grenade,\n and VOG-25R grenade.

A grenade launcher developed in the 1960th. Such grenade launchers are stored in huge quantities in army depots, from where they are transferred to the Zone. Such weapon is rare for stalkers: its huge dimensions and heavy weight make it unpopular, though it’s indispensable for some missions.\n Ammunition – OG-7V.

A model developed back in 1975 but still popular all around the world. Its magazine has low capacity, but its mechanism is absolutely reliable. Its second advantage is the use of the high-power Colt round.
 Ammunition:
 standard .45 ACP,
 improved .45 ACP Hydro-Shock.

A relatively new Swiss assault rifle for the 5.56x45 mm SS109 round. This weapon is very popular due to its accuracy, soft recoil, and high reliability.
 Ammunition:
 standard 5.56x45 mm SS109,
 armour-piercing 5.56x45 mm ÀÐ.

The SPAS 12 smooth-bore rifle was developed in the late 1970th as a universal combat weapon for the police and the assault units of the army. This weapon is very reliable and flexibly used. On the other hand, it is relatively big, expensive, and its mechanism is too complex. Probably, this is the best close range gun in the Zone.
 Ammunition:
 12x70 shot,
 12x76 slug,
 12x76 dart.

UNIQUE WEAPON. This shotgun model has a rifled bore which greatly increases its accuracy when firing darts or slugs, however, it’s difficult to use shot now.
 Ammunition:
 12x70 shot,
 12x76 slug,
 12x76 dart.

This rifle was widely used in all operations of the Soviet and Russian armies since 1960. It proved itself to be an exceptionally reliable and handy weapon. In the Zone it is preferred by the experienced stalkers of the Duty group which hunt mutants.
 Ammunition:
 standard 7.62x54 mm 7N1,
 armour-piercing 7.62x54 mm BP,
 sniper 7.62x54 mm 7N14.

UNIQUE WEAPON. A modification of the Dragunov sniper rifle. It includes a more sensitive firing mechanism and a system of recoil compensation.
 Ammunition:
 standard 7.62x54 mm 7N1,
 armour-piercing 7.62x54 mm BP,
 sniper 7.62x54 mm 7N14.

A more up-to-date version of the Dragunov rifle. A compact bull-pup model. It is very good for long trips in the Zone.
 Ammunition:
 standard 7.62x54 mm 7N1,
 armour-piercing 7.62x54 mm BP,
 sniper 7.62x54 mm 7N14.

UNIQUE WEAPON. If the stalkers’ stories are to be trusted, this SVU once belonged to an experienced stalker named Little Man (this man was really short and small). He modified his SVD himself to make it lighter and equipped it with a recoil canceller.
 Ammunition:
 standard 7.62x54 mm 7N1,
 armour-piercing 7.62x54 mm BP,
 sniper 7.62x54 mm 7N14.

This hunting rifle is widely spread but there’s nothing noteworthy about it.
 Ammunition:
 12x70 shot,
 12x76 slug,
 12x76 dart.

A reliable weapon. It possesses the German quality and reliability. It’s a compact close-range weapon. It is very popular among the veterans of the Zone.
 Ammunition:
 standard .45 ACP,
 improved .45 ACP Hydro-Shock.

This weapon is made on the basis of the Vintorez noiseless sniper rifle, but it has a folding butt, can fire bursts, and has a bigger magazine. It was originally designed for special forces fighting in the conditions demanding noiseless and flameless fire.
 Ammunition:
 standard 9x39 mm PAB-9,
 armour-piercing 9x39 mm SP-6,
 sniper 9x39 mm SP-5.

A special sniper rifle designed for noiseless and flameless sniper fire and equipped with an integrated silencer. It can pierce any armour vest at a range of 400 metres. It is a weapon highly valued by stalkers of any level.
 Ammunition:
 standard 9x39 mm PAB-9,
 armour-piercing 9x39 mm SP-6,
 sniper 9x39 mm SP-5.

UNIQUE WEAPON. A Vintorez with a dedicatory inscription by some stalker named Sergey the Quiet. None in the Zone remembers anything about the origin of this weapon, its first owner must have died long ago. This weapon has a unique quality: the bullets fired from this rifle have a higher speed and a straighter trajectory.
 Ammunition:
 standard 9x39 mm PAB-9,
 armour-piercing 9x39 mm SP-6,
 sniper 9x39 mm SP-5.

An excellent German pistol, it is highly reliable, has a capacious magazine and a good accuracy of fire, especially this model designed for the 9 mm Parabellum round.
 Ammunition:
 standard 9x19 mm Parabellum,
 improved 9õ19 mm PBP.

UNIQUE WEAPON. This pistol differs from the serial model in a dedicatory inscription made for a well-known politician. It is as handy and reliable as the standard model. No one knows how it got to the Zone, but its price is surely very high.

An American smooth-bore pump-action rifle made for use in the most hostile environment. It’s very reliable. All its details are covered with anticorrosive coating.
 Ammunition:
 12x70 shot,
 12x76 slug,
 12x76 dart.

UNIQUE WEAPON. The under-barrel magazine of this rifle contains a small piece of a Gravy artefact at the position of the first round. The piece of the artefact accelerates the bullet. As a result, the killing power of this rifle is increased.
 Ammunition:
 12x70 shot,
 12x76 slug,
 12x76 dart.
Walther P99 with a dedicatory inscription
